channel.title: How Do I Change Admin Commands To Mod?

item.title: How Do I Change Admin Commands To Mod?
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Refering to your title, just change the player rights from 2 to 1, use common sense dude, i’m not even gonna bother helping you with that one problem posted in your topic, change your title if that’s the main issue.

item.title: How Do I Change Admin Commands To Mod?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Instead of
p.username.equals(“bob”)) {

Replace that ^
With this V

p.rights >= 1 (For MOD+)
OR
p.rights >= 2 (For ADMIN+)

So, that line should look like this:
else if (cmd[0].equals(“kill”) && p.rights >= 1)) {
OR
else if (cmd[0].equals(“kill”) && p.rights >= 2)) {

Hope this helped.
~Jc22493

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I Change Admin Commands To Mod?

item.title: How Do I Change Admin Commands To Mod?
item.dc:creator: @N0vlafe N0vlafe
item.description:
@N0vlafe wrote:

else if (cmd[0].equals(“kill”) && p.username.equals(“bob”)) {
String person = playerCommand.substring((playerCommand.indexOf(" ") + 1));
Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)];
if (p2 != null) {
p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You have just StrikedDown " + p2.username);
p2.frames.sendMessage(p2, "You have just been striked down by " + p.username);
p2.requestGFX(1621, 0);
p2.appendHit(255, 0);
p2.updateReq = true;
p2.appearanceUpdateReq = true;
}
it looks like this, but it look like it owner command but when i delete the && p.username.equals(“bob”)) it still owner commands so how do i make the command admin or mod only?

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I Change Admin Commands To Mod?
